service_example_inputs: samples, objects (?? I'm not sure this is the right answer)
service_example_outputs: ?? not sure waht to put here
service_methods: Micro-XRF analysis was performed using a Bruker ARTAX spectrometer equipped with a Mo target, SDD detector and a polycapillary to focus the X-ray beam. Measurements were collected using the following setup: 30 kV, 500 μA current. A 25 µm molybdenum filter was used in the beam path, mainly to reduce unwanted Bragg-peaks in the spectrum. Measurements were carried out in air. The working distance was about 1 mm and the spot size about 100 μm (depending slightly on the X-ray energy. The instrument has a camera-laser system for sample visualising the sample surface. The measuring head of the spectrometer is motorized and can be moved in X, Y and Z direction. This facilitates an easy positioning of the sample and enables line or area scans.
research_disciplines: Heritage science, preventive conservation, Archaeology, Ethnography, technical art history,
pid: ?? There is no landing page for this service.
scope_note: XRF analysis with energy dispersive detection for qualitative or quantitative material analysis. Metal alloys could be analysed quantitative while other materials like elements on paintings are commonly assessed in a qualitative way.
service_limitations: The access to the service is limited by the resources and capacities of the RF-SPK who is providing this service. The decision if a service can be provided is taken by the RF-SPK.
service_version: Is this a question of hardware/machine or also data treatment? There might be several service versions used even at the same time: e.g. we have different way of evaluation the data (quantitative, qualitative or sometimes also semi-quantitative
service_output: spx spectra, excel table with result, images of measurement spot, report pdf
